alert.note: Alert for Ripley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 05 at 9:42PM EDT until April 10 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...In Southeast Indiana, Ripley County. * WHEN...Until 115 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 941 PM EDT, emergency management reported minor flooding in along Laughery Creek in Ripley County. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Batesville, Versailles, Milan, Osgood, Sunman, Holton, Napoleon, Versailles Lake, Otter Village, Olean, Benham, New Marion, Ballstown, Rexville, Cross Plains, Friendship, Huntersville, Penntown and Interstate 74 at State Route 101.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
